runs.comm: starts with a bouncer and the batsman ducks under it.
back of a length with a bit of width outside off. Coetzer throws his bat at it, away from his body, doesn't connect
back of a length on off stump, punched back firmly to the bowler
yorker on leg stump, and Coetzer nearly falls over as he lifts his feet out of the way and digs it out towards square leg
length ball outside off, and he's beaten for pace and angle, once again lashing out without any foot movement
back of a length on middle stump, hops up and defends back to the bowler
full-toss close to off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball, lots of width outside off. Gets forward and slaps it powerfully but straight to Smith at backward point
off-stump yorker, blocked back to the bowler
length ball outside off, goes for a flat-bat slap through the off-side and under-edges it, on the bounce, to the keeper
this one's shorter and MacLeod can stand up tall and slap it away with a roll of the wrists to the cover point boundary
and again, even shorter this time, and he gets on top of the bounce and dismisses it in front of square
length ball outside off, angling away. Coetzer goes for the on-the-up punch, again zero footwork, and again he's beaten
length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler
edged, drops short of third slip. Full outside off and again Coetzer pushes at it with no feet. Thick edge, but it doesn't carry through to the crouching Smith
now the bouncer, Coetzer ducks safely underneath

gone! This time it was just back of a length and close enough to off stump for the leaden-footed Coetzer to edge rather than miss as he aimed a massive back-foot punch, looking to go through the covers. Flies to Smith at shoulder height, and he takes it easily
greets him with a yorker, a bit of shape into the left-hander. He stayed nice and still, with a low backlift, and jabbed it away into the off side to deny Starc another maiden

length ball on middle stump, a bit of swerve away towards off stump. Machan looks to clip it through the leg side, and pops it in the air off the leading edge, well out of reach of Maxwell at square leg
full and wide and MacLeod gets down on one knee and plays a good-looking square drive through point
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
full and wide once more and this time MacLeod simply lashes at it, with no intention of keeping the ball down, and carves it away over cover point
short ball now, MacLeod ducks under and it slants away down the leg side
back of a length, angling into the body, tucked away off the hips towards long leg
length ball on off and middle, defended to mid-on
length ball outside off, and that is excellent timing, just angles his bat and punches away from his body to send it running away through point
back of a length again, angled too far down the leg side
short ball, rising to throat height, and he jumps and pops it in the air off the splice of the bat, but there's no short leg
lbw appeal, not given, not reviewed. It was very full, and it swung in and pinged his front pad in front of middle stump. Was there a tiny inside edge on it?
shortish now, angling into the body, hops across to defend into the on side
back of a length on off stump, chopped down to backward point
shortish again, and again he rises to his full height and slaps it firmly, but again he can't beat the backward point fielder
length ball on off stump, stabbed away to the left of the diving backward point fielder, down to third man
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
full, floated across towards off stump, and Machan just stands there and punches it hard down the ground, between the bowler and mid-on
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra cover

yorker on leg stump, and that is very nicely done by MacLeod. Stayed nice and still, waited for it to come to him, and moved his front leg out of the way to clip it away crisply through backward square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
back of a length on middle and leg, hops across to tuck it away towards midwicket
length ball on middle and leg, can't connect with the flick and it strikes him on the thigh pad
good short ball, rising steeply over off stump. MacLeod drops his hands well and leans his upper body out of the way
ouch. That was short, with a little bit of width on it, and MacLeod has played the cut fairly well, but this one he pops into the air, and straight into the hands of backward point
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
length ball on off stump, presses forward to block to short cover
excellent bouncer from Watson, and Mommsen goes second ball. Has to drag the pull from over his right shoulder, and he could only top-edge it to Starc stationed at backward square leg
back of a length outside off, punched towards short cover
another well-directed bouncer, angling across Machan, but he manages to get on top of it and hook it down towards long leg
length ball angling away from off stump, and Machan goes after it, away from his body, and doesn't quite middle it, but places it pretty well over extra cover
back of a length, angling across. Coleman plays and misses, and then moves his bat inside the line to make it look as if he was leaving it
length ball on off stump, gets behind the line to squeeze it away towards backward point
back of a length outside off, punched crisply to backward point
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away towards short midwicket
short, well-directed, rising over middle stump. Coleman sways away nicely, keeping his eyes on the ball and his hands close to his body
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra cover
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the off side
short on off stump, and he pulls it away towards deep backward square leg

length ball on off stump, and that's a nice shot from Machan, simply extends the follow-through of what's a fairly orthodox straight drive, hitting on the up and over mid-on, one bounce and into the boundary
back of a length on leg stump, blocked towards short midwicket
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, defended to short extra cover
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off

you'd say that's a good bouncer from Johnson if this was Test cricket. He had to pull his hands away from the ball in a hurry. But it was just a fraction down the leg side, and umpires can be merciless sometimes

Johnson gets into the party now. Back of a length, fourth-stump, angling away. No footwork in that attempted back-foot punch, and Clarke dives to his right from second slip to grab the edge, lovely low catch
shortish ball, angling across Berrington. He leaves it alone, keeping his bat well inside the line
this is another well-directed short ball, rising to chest height on middle and leg stump. Jumps to ride the bounce and plays it down into the off side with soft hands
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away towards short midwicket
back of a length close to off stump. Trusts the angle and lets it go
another discomfiting short ball. Rising steeply towards the batsman's throat. He jumps in the air again, and manages to squeeze it away towards third man, keeping it down
and he strikes first ball, with a fairly rubbish ball. It's floated up outside off, it's a half-volley, and Berrington slices his drive in the air, straight to Warner at cover
tossed up on off stump, blocked into the off side
once again it's floated across the batsman, wide outside off. Goes for the big drive and doesn't connect
length ball on middle stump, Cross blocks it back towards the bowler
back of a length, turning down the leg side. Cross can't connect with the flick, the unsighted Haddin can't collect behind the stumps
full-toss on off stump, blocked to short midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven to the left of sweeper cover
length ball outside off, left alone
full on off stump, and that is superb timing from Cross. Stays next to the line, just slices down with an open face to send it racing away to the left of backward point
banged in, and it rises over Cross' left shoulder. As all good bouncers do, it leaves the batsman jumping and ducking at the same time.
now the full and wide follow-up, invites Cross to drive. His feet still retain the memory of the previous ball and go nowhere, and the ball beats his outside edge
another full, wide tempter. Again no footwork, unless moving your back foot towards square leg counts as footwork, and again he's nowhere near connecting
length ball outside off, angling away, Cross has a poke and miss
full on middle stump, Machan clips to mid-on
short outside off, slapped to cover point
tossed up on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
down the track now, isn't in the best position to loft over mid-on, ends up dragging it towards midwicket
full on middle and leg, flicked wide of mid-on
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot to block into the off side
shortish, angling down leg. Shuffles across to work it to fine leg, can't connect
short ball on off stump, sits up a bit, and Machan plays it very well, front leg goes up in a prance and he pulls it away to the square leg boundary
short and wide and Machan stabs it away over point, making a conscious effort to hit it in the air and out of reach of the fielder there
shortish, angling into the body. Hops to ride the bounce and defends into the off side
very full on leg stump, clipped away through backward square leg
banged in short. Machan ducks underneath
tossed up outside off, Cross carves the drive away to the right of the cover point fielder
tossed up outside off, driven to cover point
short now, some width too, but he slaps it straight to the busy Warner at cover point
back of a length close to off stump, blocked into the off side
a bit slower and fuller, gets forward to defend
a touch short but too slow to cut safely. Shapes for the attacking shot, ends up prodding it away softly into the off side
back of a length, a bit of swing away from the left hander to accentuate the angle. Blocked into the off side

and Cummins is among the wickets now. It's shortish, on the hips. Machan shuffles across to try and tuck it into the leg side. It gets big on him and he ends up popping it in the air, offering a simple catch to Faulkner at long leg
banged in short outside off, Cross leaves it alone
a bit fuller but just as wide. Left alone again
another. It's short on a fifth-stump line, and Cross' weight was on the front foot. He was in no position to play that, it got big on him, and kissed the shoulder of his bat through to the keeper
back of a length, angling across. Taylor plays and misses
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
tossed up outside off, presses forward to defend
down the track now and that's a nice shot from Taylor. It's tossed up outside off, and he whips it with the turn, in the air and it's one bounce over the wide long-on boundary
back of a length outside off, blocked into the covers
tossed up outside off and Davey gets down on one knee to slog it away over midwicket
floated up outside off and Davey plays a crunching drive through cover
full on middle stump, driven to the left of mid-on, forcing Faulkner into a diving save
back of a length outside off, left alone
very full outside off. Davey leaves again
on the pads, clipped to backward square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, defended into the on side
yorker on off and middle. Does well to get his feet out of the way and jam his bat down on it
again very full, on off stump, blocked to mid-off
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
very full outside off, jabbed into the covers
length ball angling away from off stump, left alone
back of a length on off stump, doesn't come on as well as Davey would have liked. He wanted to punch through cover, and it went off the inside half of his bat towards midwicket
fuller now, on middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket
full and wide and Davey steps forward and flows into a gorgeous drive through extra cover

gone, eight down. That's a length ball, angling into the corridor. No footwork from Taylor, not the first Scotland batsman to suffer from that issue, and he pokes hesitantly and nicks it through to the keeper
greets him with a middle-stump yorker. Jams down on it and squeezes it away towards short fine leg
back of a length, angling into the body, tucked away to long leg
full outside off, poked away to the left of short extra cover
length ball outside off, left alone
full, angling into the pads, and that is clipped away so elegantly through square leg. He looks like a proper batsman, Davey
length ball outside off, blocked towards point

full outside off, driven to the left of Starc at mid-off. Makes a sliding stop, throws at the bowler's end, the bowler was still returning from his follow-through. Finch was haring away to back up from mid-on, couldn't get there in time, and they concede four overthrows
back of a length on off stump, blocked into the off side
a bit fuller and he gets a positive stride out to defend to mid-off
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
down the track now, looks to pull over midwicket. Stops on him a bit and he ends up mistiming it a touch, over the gap between midwicket and mid-on
short outside off. Leask swings and misses, looking for the pull
short and wide and that is powerful from Leask. Makes himself just a bit of room by clearing his front leg, and flat-bats it away through cover
once again short and wide, and that's another boundary in the same area. It just sat up, and this time he made a bit more room and rolled his wrists over at the top of the bounce
overpitched outside off and that's three in a row. Stays inside the line and jabs it away through cover point
a bit straighter now, almost in the blockhole. Makes room and stabs it to point
dug in short now, outside off. Leask goes for the pull and doesn't connect
fullish on off stump, presses forward to block down the ground
bouncer, Davey gets into a low crouch under it

fullish on off stump and Davey looked to push it down the ground. Straightened off the pitch and he ended up popping it in the air off the inside half of the ball, falls just short of the diving Clarke at short midwicket
length ball, angling across, defended towards point
another bouncer, Davey ducks again
back of a length on middle and leg. Can't connect with the flick and the ball hits him on the thigh pad
slower ball, full and wide, comes forward and eases it into the gap at cover point
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
full on middle stump, clipped away towards square leg
length ball close to off stump, blocked to mid-off
short ball, angling into the body. Fends at it and pops it in the air, but drops his bottom hand and it falls a short distance away from the batsman, into the off side
back of a length, angling into off and middle, tucked away towards deep backward square leg
length ball on off stump, and Leask creates room for himself once again, and simply slaps it back down the ground, between bowler and mid-off
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Davey is back and across to defend
clatter. Off-stump yorker, and Davey is late bringing his bat down. It actually straightened a touch and went past the outside edge
another yorker, outside off, this time. Wardlaw backs away, looks to poke it away through point, can't connect
boom, and that off stump takes another beating. It's full and fast and Wardlaw gave himself room to play through the off side, bat was nowhere near it in the end. Again it straightened off the pitch
